鬼.definition: disembodied spirit; ghost; devil; (suffix) person with a certain vice or addiction etc; sly; crafty; resourceful (variant of 詭|诡[gui3]); one of the 28 constellations of ancient Chinese astronomy

鬼使神差.definition: demons and gods at work (idiom); unexplained event crying out for a supernatural explanation; curious coincidence

鬼哭狼嗥.definition: variant of 鬼哭狼嚎[gui3 ku1 lang2 hao2]

鬼哭狼嚎.definition: to wail like ghosts and howl like wolves (idiom)

鬼壓身.definition: see 鬼壓床|鬼压床[gui3 ya1 chuang2]

鬼子.definition: devil (derog. term for foreign invaders); (esp. during resistance against Japanese aggression 1931-1945) Jap; Nip

鬼怕惡人.definition: lit. ghosts are afraid of evil too; an evil person fears someone even more evil (idiom)

鬼才信.definition: who would believe it!; what rubbish!

鬼扯腿.definition: unable to restrain oneself; pulling and tugging at each other

鬼把戲.definition: sinister plot; dirty trick; cheap trick

鬼斧神工.definition: supernaturally fine craft (idiom); the work of the Gods; uncanny workmanship; superlative craftsmanship

鬼混.definition: to hang around; to fool around; to live aimlessly

鬼由心生.definition: devils are born in the heart (idiom); fears originate in the mind

鬼秤.definition: (coll.) rigged scale (used to deceive customers by displaying incorrect weight)

鬼臉.definition: wry face; to grimace; to pull a face; comic face; face mask; devil mask

鬼計多端.definition: full of devilish tricks and cunning stratagems (idiom); sly; crafty; malicious

鬼話連篇.definition: to tell one lie after another (idiom); to talk nonsense; bogus story

鬼迷心竅.definition: to be obsessed; to be possessed

鬼遮眼.definition: selective blindness caused by a ghost, whereby one fails to notice obvious dangers

鬼鴞.definition: (bird species of China) boreal owl (Aegolius funereus)
